tn.text: These were festivals that the Lord had appointed times for. The people were to worship him at these festivals. AT: "the festivals for Yahweh" or "Yahweh's festivals"
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do on special days and times.

tn.ref: the seventh day is a Sabbath of complete rest
tn.text: This is something the people must do habitually. After every six days in which they can work, they must rest on the seventh day.

The requirement that people assemble to worship God on that day is spoken of as if that day were the assembly. AT: "a holy day, when you must assemble together to worship me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"at their proper times"

tn.ref: first month, on the fourteenth day of the month ... the fifteenth day of the same month
tn.text: The first month of the Hebrew calendar marks when Yahweh brought the Israelites out of Egypt. The fourteenth day and fifteenth day are around the beginning of April on the Western calendar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"at sunset"

tn.ref: The first day you must set apart to gather together
tn.text: "You must set apart the first day to gather together" or "You must treat the first day as different and gather together"
They would present it to Yahweh by burning it on the altar.

tn.ref: The seventh day is an assembly set apart to Yahweh
tn.text: The requirement that people assemble on that day is spoken of as if that day were the assembly. Being set apart to Yahweh means that when they assemble, they must worship Yahweh. AT: "The seventh day is a day when you must assemble together to worship Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"the first sheaf" or "the first bundle of grain." A "sheaf" is a bunch of grain that a person has tied together.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "for Yahweh to accept it" or "and I will accept it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
An ephah is 22 liters. AT: "four and a half liters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
A hin is 3.7 liters. AT: "one liter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
"nor cooked or uncooked grain"

tn.ref: This will be a permanent statute throughout your people's generations
tn.text: This means that they and their descendants must obey this command forever. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:15|3:17]].
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
"50 days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This is the ordinal for number seven. See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]]
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

tn.ref: made from two tenths of an ephah. They must be made from fine flour and baked with yeast
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you have made from two tenths of an ephah of flour and then baked with yeast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is approximately 4.5 liters. AT: "four and a half liters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

tn.ref: and producing a sweet aroma for Yahweh
tn.text: The Lord's pleasure with the aroma represents his pleasure with the person who burns the offering. AT: "and Yahweh will be pleased with you" or "that pleases the Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

tn.ref: When you reap the harvest of your land, you must not completely reap the corners of your fields
tn.text: "When you gather your crops, do not gather them all the way to the edges of your fields"

tn.ref: the seventh month, the first day of that month
tn.text: This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. The first day is near the middle of September on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
a period of time that was only for worship and not for work

tn.ref: you must offer a sacrifice made by fire to Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must offer a sacrifice that you make by fire to Yahweh" or "you must burn an offering on the altar to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: tenth day of this seventh month
tn.text: This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. The tenth day is near the end of September on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

On this day each year the high priest made a sacrifice to Yahweh so that Yahweh would forgive all the sins of the people of Israel. AT: "the Day of Sacrifice for Forgiveness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do every year.

tn.ref: must be cut off from his people
tn.text: Being excluded is spoken of as being cut off. See how you translated this idea in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:07:19|7:20]]. AT: "must be excluded from his people" or "you must separate that person from his people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do every year.
"on the Day of Atonement"

tn.ref: This will be a permanent statute throughout your people's generations
tn.text: This means that they and their descendants must obey this command forever. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:03:15|3:17]].
This is not the same as the Sabbath they observed every week on the seventh day. This was a special Sabbath on the Day of Atonement.
In this case humbling themselves implies that they would not eat any food. This can be stated clearly. AT: "you must humble yourselves and eat nothing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the ninth day of the month
tn.text: This refers to the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. The ninth day is near the end of September on Western calendars. This can be made explicit. AT: "the ninth day of the seventh month" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"From sunset to sunset on the next day"

tn.ref: fifteenth day of the seventh month
tn.text: This is near the beginning of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

This is a celebration during which the people of Israel lived in temporary shelters for seven days as a way to remember the time they spent living in the wilderness after they left Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Yahweh is giving instructions for the Festival of Shelters.
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do every year.
This refers to the festivals mentioned in 23:1-36.
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do every year.

This is a celebration during which the people of Israel lived in temporary shelters for seven days as a way to remember the time they spent living in the wilderness after they left Egypt. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:23:33|23:34]].

tn.ref: fifteenth day of the seventh month
tn.text: This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. The fifteenth day is near the beginning of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: when you have gathered in the fruits
tn.text: The word "fruits" here represents various kinds of crops.  AT: "after you have gathered the crops" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Yahweh continues his instructions for the Festival of Shelters.

tn.ref: branches of palm trees ... willows from streams
tn.text: Possible uses for these branches are 1) to make temporary shelters or 2) to wave them as part of their joyous celebration. Some translations state their use clearly; other translations leave it implicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
trees with long, narrow leaves, which grow near water (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
Yahweh continues his instructions for the Festival of Shelters.

tn.ref: your descendants, generation after generation, may learn
tn.text: "Generation after generation" is an idiom that refers to each generation that lives after another. AT: "your descendants belonging to all future generations may learn" or "all your descendants may learn forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
